decks.notes: Focus on using cards that lower your own life total to increase the power of Death's Shadow, while also having control elements to disrupt your opponent's game plan and protect your creatures. Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler provide additional threats while Snapcaster Mage allows you to reuse key spells. Use Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt your opponent's hand, Stubborn Denial for protection, and Fatal Push and Terminate for removal. Serum Visions and Thought Scour help you dig for your key cards. Overall, the deck aims to be aggressive while also maintaining some control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion. Life from the Loam helps to keep the engine going by returning key lands like Dakmor Salvage. Once the graveyard is filled, the deck aims to use Conflagrate and Collective Brutality to deal large amounts of direct damage to the opponent, while also benefiting from the triggered abilities of the graveyard creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful and synergistic combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to combo with bounce lands and explosive lands to generate mana quickly and efficiently. This allows the player to cast Primeval Titan early and search for strong lands like Vesuva and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion to enhance their board state. Cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout help ramp up the mana production even further. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and land interactions.

This Aggro Jund deck focuses on disruption and efficient removal spells to control the board while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to quickly close out the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand early on with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Torch of Defiance for additional value. With a mix of hand disruption, removal, and powerful threats, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and keep the opponent on the back foot.

The main concept of the deck is to control the board early on with disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail, while ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures using Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Walking Ballista to pressure the opponent and maintain board presence, with the option to exile or remove key threats using cards like All Is Dust and Dismember. The inclusion of utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Sea Gate Wreckage further enhances the deck's flexibility and resilience.

The primary focus of this deck is to aggressively play Death's Shadow while utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's hand and board. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps to find Death's Shadow quickly, while Mishra's Bauble and Serum Visions provide card advantage and consistency. Liliana, the Last Hope and Snapcaster Mage offer additional value and protection. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure with Death's Shadow and close out games quickly through efficient removal and disruption.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Explore, in order to cast the powerful combo card Scapeshift. By sacrificing lands and searching for multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, players can deal massive amounts of damage to their opponent in one turn. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to control the board, as well as Primeval Titan to search for Valakut or other key lands. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with Valakut triggers.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Death's Shadow mechanic as a powerful aggro strategy, utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to quickly diminish your own life total and boost the power of Death's Shadow. The deck also features efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, as well as disruption cards such as Inquisition of Kozilek and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's game plan. With a focus on speed, aggression, and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main goal of this deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By constantly applying pressure and preventing the opponent from gaining life, it aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck is focused on maximizing damage output while maintaining a fast pace, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with relentless aggression. It also incorporates a land base that supports the deck's strategy by providing consistent access to the necessary mana sources.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently cast a high number of spells in a single turn to generate a lethal storm count. By using cards like Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance to reduce spell costs, along with rituals and cantrips to churn through the deck, the deck aims to find and play key combo pieces like Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens to finish off the opponent. The deck focuses on chaining spells together to create overwhelming board states and win the game in one explosive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble in order to lower your life total and grow Death's Shadow into a massive threat. Using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, you can disrupt your opponent's hand while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to control the board and clear the way for your creatures to attack for lethal damage.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing the player's own life total in order to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat on the board. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while leveraging efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to control the board. The deck also includes card draw and graveyard manipulation to ensure consistent access to Death's Shadow and other powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. Overall, the key strategy is to be aggressive and disruptive while leveraging the power of Death's Shadow.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a powerful, hexproof creature by attaching multiple aura enchantments to it, creating a large threat that is difficult for opponents to deal with. The key strategy is to protect the creature while boosting its power and toughness with various aura enchantments, allowing it to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can mount a defense. The deck also includes removal spells to deal with any threats the opponent may play.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively, utilizing cards like Tarfire, Fatal Push, and Death's Shadow to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's resources while also enabling Death's Shadow to be a large threat early in the game. The deck also includes ways to search for specific cards with Traverse the Ulvenwald and Mishra's Bauble, and has versatile removal options like Terminate and Liliana of the Veil. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing for an infinite life gain loop with Kitchen Finks and a win condition with Walking Ballista. The creatures toolbox aspect of the deck provides flexibility and options for different situations, while Collected Company and Chord of Calling help to find key pieces of the combo. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of Gavony Township adds additional synergy and utility to the deck.

The main concept of this Aggro - Death And Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Leonin Arbiter, and Wasteland Strangler, while also applying pressure with creatures like Flickerwisp and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Path to Exile and disruption effects, while utilizing the synergy between Eldrazi creatures and Aether Vial to generate incremental advantage. Additionally, the deck can also gain card advantage with Dark Confidant and Tidehollow Sculler.
